description: This trap is sent when the Active Variant of a Link is changed (that
includes the case when a user performs Save to the Variant that is Active).

event.Summary: Active variant of link is changed to variant $v1

description: For V5.1: the currently Active Variant Id. on this ML.
For V5.2: the currently Active Variant Id.
128=none.
variables.name: OPTIMUX-MIB::v51MlCurrActiveVar

description: The trap is sent every time there is a change in
the state of one of the PS..
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OPTIMUX-MIB::optMxConfigChange OPTIMUX-MIB::optIndex i 1 RAD-MIB::agnLed s EXAMPLE

description: optIndex = 1 is for local Optimux.
optIndex = 2 is for remote Optimux.
variables.name: OPTIMUX-MIB::optIndex

description: This entry specifies the LEDs status of the agent module . Each led will be represented by 4
bits where the first 2 bits (left) will specify the status :
(00=NA, 01=OFF, 10=ON, 11=BLINK)
and the next two bits (right) will specify the color :
(00=GREEN, 01=RED, 10=YELLOW, 11=GRAY)
variables.name: RAD-MIB::agnLed

description: The trap is sent every time there is a change in
the agnIndication variable.
For Optimux XL family, from ver 4.1 and up, this trap should be sent
upon any change in the agnNearFarConnection variable
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OPTIMUX-MIB::optMxAgentFault RAD-MIB::agnIndication i 1 RAD-MIB::agnLed s EXAMPLE

description: Attribute describing the state of the entity the agent is responsible for.
In case of a modular entity, the value of this attribute will be according
to the component which is in the worst state.
The order of severity (from top to bottom) is:
critical-> major (or faulty)-> minor-> event-> warning-> normal (off).
variables.name: RAD-MIB::agnIndication

description: This entry specifies the LEDs status of the agent module . Each led will be represented by 4
bits where the first 2 bits (left) will specify the status :
(00=NA, 01=OFF, 10=ON, 11=BLINK)
and the next two bits (right) will specify the color :
(00=GREEN, 01=RED, 10=YELLOW, 11=GRAY)
variables.name: RAD-MIB::agnLed

description: optLineStatusChange trap is sent when the value of an instance
dsx1LineStatus changes. It can be utilized by an NMS to trigger polls.
When the line status change results from a higher level line status
change (i.e. ds3), then no traps for the ds1 are sent.

Summary.eval: ($v1==1) ? 'No alarm present' : (($v1==2) ? 'Far end LOF' : (($v1==4) ? 'Near end sending LOF indication' : (($v1==8) ? 'Far end sending AIS' : (($v1==16) ? 'Near end sending AIS' : (($v1==32) ? 'Near end LOF' : (($v1==64) ? 'Near end Loss of Signal' : (($v1==128) ? 'Near end is looped' : (($v1==256) ? 'E1 TS16 AIS' : (($v1==512) ? 'Far end sending TS16 LOMF' : (($v1==1024) ? 'Near end sending TS16 LOMF' : (($v1==2048) ? 'Near end detects a test code' : (($v1==4096) ? 'Any line status not defined here' : (($v1==8192) ? 'Near end in unavailable signal state' : (($v1==16384) ? 'DS2 payload AIS' : 'DS2 performance threshold exceeded'))))))))))))))

description: This variable indicates the line status of the
interface. It contains loopback, failure
received alarm and transmitted alarms
information.
The dsx1LineStatus is a bitmap represented as a
sum; therefore, it can represent multiple failures
(alarms) and a LoopbackState simultaneously.
dsx1NoAlarm must be set if and only if no other
flag is set.
If the dsx1loopbackState bit is set, the loopback
in effect can be determined from the
dsx1loopbackConfig object. The various bit
positions are as follows:
1 dsx1NoAlarm No alarm present
2 dsx1RcvFarEndLOF Far end LOF (a.k.a.Yellow Alarm)
4 dsx1XmtFarEndLOF Near end sending LOF indication
8 dsx1RcvAIS Far end sending AIS
16 dsx1XmtAIS Near end sending AIS
32 dsx1LossOfFrame Near end LOF (a.k.a.Red Alarm)
64 dsx1LossOfSignal Near end Loss of Signal
128 dsx1LoopbackState Near end is looped
256 dsx1T16AIS E1 TS16 AIS
512 dsx1RcvFarEndLOMF Far end sending TS16 LOMF
1024 dsx1XmtFarEndLOMF Near end sending TS16 LOMF
2048 dsx1RcvTestCode Near end detects a test code
4096 dsx1OtherFailure Any line status not defined here
8192 dsx1UnavailSigState Near end in unavailable signal state
16384 dsx1NetEquipOOS Carrier equipment out of service
32768 dsx1RcvPayloadAIS DS2 payload AIS
65536 dsx1Ds2PerfThreshold DS2 performance threshold exceeded
variables.name: DS1-MIB::dsx1LineStatus

description: The value of MIB II's sysUpTime object at the
time this DS1 entered its current line status
state. If the current state was entered prior to
the last re-initialization of the proxy-agent
then this object contains a zero value.
variables.name: DS1-MIB::dsx1LineStatusLastChange

description: This trap alerts the console if there is module
enrollement/de-enrollement
optMdIdx = 1 is for local Optimux.
optMdIdx = 2 is for remote Optimux.
variables.name: OPTIMUX-MIB::optMdIdx

description: For Optimux XL:
Slot A = 1, Slot B = 2, Slot C = 3, Slot D = 4
Slot Link = 5, Slot BU = 6 .
For FomiE3/R3:
Slot of Station Clock = 3, Slot of Electrical Link = 4
Slot of Optical Main Link = 5, Slot of Optical Backup Link = 6 .
For Optimux-T3:
Slot of Station Clock (internal card)= 3, Slot A = 5, Slot B = 6.
For Optimux-155/1:
E1/T1 Slot A - 1, E1/T1 Slot B- 2, LINK-A - 5, LINK-B - 6
For Optimux-155 DS3:
Common Logic+E3/T3 Slot A - 1, Common Logic+E3/T3 Slot B- 2, LINK-A - 5, LINK-B - 6
variables.name: OPTIMUX-MIB::optMdSltIdx

description: This trap alerts the console if there is changes in the
loopback status of some of the line.

Summary.eval: ($v2==1 && $v3==1) ? 'No loopback on DS1 and DS3 interfaces' : (($v2==1) ? 'Loopback on DS3 interface' : (($v3==1) ? 'Loopback on DS1 interface' : 'Loopback on DS1 and DS3 interfaces'))

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OPTIMUX-MIB::optLoopbackStatusChange RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 DS1-MIB::dsx1LoopbackStatus i 1 DS3-MIB::dsx3LoopbackStatus i 1

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: This variable represents the current state of the
loopback on the DS1 interface. It contains
information about loopbacks established by a
manager and remotely from the far end.
The dsx1LoopbackStatus is a bitmap represented as
a sum; therefore, it can represent multiple
loopbacks simultaneously.
The various bit positions are as follows:
1 dsx1NoLoopback
2 dsx1NearEndPayloadLoopback
4 dsx1NearEndLineLoopback
8 dsx1NearEndOtherLoopback
16 dsx1NearEndInwardLoopback
32 dsx1FarEndPayloadLoopback
64 dsx1FarEndLineLoopback
variables.name: DS1-MIB::dsx1LoopbackStatus

description: This variable represents the current state of the
loopback on the DS3 interface. It contains
information about loopbacks established by a
manager and remotely from the far end.
The dsx3LoopbackStatus is a bit map represented as
a sum, therefore is can represent multiple
loopbacks simultaneously.
The various bit positions are:
1 dsx3NoLoopback
2 dsx3NearEndPayloadLoopback
4 dsx3NearEndLineLoopback
8 dsx3NearEndOtherLoopback
16 dsx3NearEndInwardLoopback
32 dsx3FarEndPayloadLoopback
64 dsx3FarEndLineLoopback
variables.name: DS3-MIB::dsx3LoopbackStatus

description: optXlLineStatusChange trap is sent when the value of an instance
dsx1LineStatus changes. It can be utilized by an NMS to trigger polls.

Summary.eval: ($v3==1) ? 'No alarm present' : (($v3==2) ? 'Far end LOF' : (($v3==4) ? 'Near end sending LOF indication' : (($v3==8) ? 'Far end sending AIS' : (($v3==16) ? 'Near end sending AIS' : (($v3==32) ? 'Near end LOF' : (($v3==64) ? 'Near end Loss of Signal' : (($v3==128) ? 'Near end is looped' : (($v3==256) ? 'E1 TS16 AIS' : (($v3==512) ? 'Far end sending TS16 LOMF' : (($v3==1024) ? 'Near end sending TS16 LOMF' : (($v3==2048) ? 'Near end detects a test code' : (($v3==4096) ? 'Any line status not defined here' : (($v3==8192) ? 'Near end in unavailable signal state' : (($v3==16384) ? 'DS2 payload AIS' : 'DS2 performance threshold exceeded'))))))))))))))

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OPTIMUX-MIB::optXlLineStatusChange RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 OPTIMUX-MIB::optMdModLed s EXAMPLE DS1-MIB::dsx1LineStatus i 9999 DS3-MIB::dsx3LineStatus i 1

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: The meaning of each bit depends on the module type.
variables.name: OPTIMUX-MIB::optMdModLed

description: This variable indicates the line status of the
interface. It contains loopback, failure
received alarm and transmitted alarms
information.
The dsx1LineStatus is a bitmap represented as a
sum; therefore, it can represent multiple failures
(alarms) and a LoopbackState simultaneously.
dsx1NoAlarm must be set if and only if no other
flag is set.
If the dsx1loopbackState bit is set, the loopback
in effect can be determined from the
dsx1loopbackConfig object. The various bit
positions are as follows:
1 dsx1NoAlarm No alarm present
2 dsx1RcvFarEndLOF Far end LOF (a.k.a.Yellow Alarm)
4 dsx1XmtFarEndLOF Near end sending LOF indication
8 dsx1RcvAIS Far end sending AIS
16 dsx1XmtAIS Near end sending AIS
32 dsx1LossOfFrame Near end LOF (a.k.a.Red Alarm)
64 dsx1LossOfSignal Near end Loss of Signal
128 dsx1LoopbackState Near end is looped
256 dsx1T16AIS E1 TS16 AIS
512 dsx1RcvFarEndLOMF Far end sending TS16 LOMF
1024 dsx1XmtFarEndLOMF Near end sending TS16 LOMF
2048 dsx1RcvTestCode Near end detects a test code
4096 dsx1OtherFailure Any line status not defined here
8192 dsx1UnavailSigState Near end in unavailable signal state
16384 dsx1NetEquipOOS Carrier equipment out of service
32768 dsx1RcvPayloadAIS DS2 payload AIS
65536 dsx1Ds2PerfThreshold DS2 performance threshold exceeded
variables.name: DS1-MIB::dsx1LineStatus

description: This variable indicates the Line Status of the
interface. It contains loopback state information
and failure state information. The dsx3LineStatus
is a bit map represented as a sum, therefore, it
can represent multiple failures and a loopback
(see dsx3LoopbackConfig object for the type of
loopback) simultaneously. The dsx3NoAlarm must be
set if and only if no other flag is set.
If the dsx3loopbackState bit is set, the loopback
in effect can be determined from the
dsx3loopbackConfig object.
The various bit positions are:
1 dsx3NoAlarm No alarm present
2 dsx3RcvRAIFailure Receiving Yellow/Remote Alarm Indication
4 dsx3XmitRAIAlarm Transmitting Yellow/Remote Alarm Indication
8 dsx3RcvAIS Receiving AIS failure state
16 dsx3XmitAIS Transmitting AIS
32 dsx3LOF Receiving LOF failure state
64 dsx3LOS Receiving LOS failure state
128 dsx3LoopbackState Looping the received signal
256 dsx3RcvTestCode Receiving a Test Pattern
512 dsx3OtherFailure any line status not defined here
1024 dsx3UnavailSigState Near End in Unavailable Signal State
2048 dsx3NetEquipOOS Carrier Equipment Out of Service
variables.name: DS3-MIB::dsx3LineStatus

description: The trap is sent whenever there is a transition from a no alarm
state to a state with at least one active alarm.

Summary.eval: ($v1==3) ? 'Interface alarm is on' : 'Interface alarm is off'

description: The variable is on(3) when there is any active alarm
on this interface.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::atmInterfaceAlarmStatus

description: This trap alerts of major problems in the device.

event.Summary: Major problem detected in the device

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OPTIMUX-MIB::systemTrap RAD-MIB::agnLed s EXAMPLE RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity i 5

description: This entry specifies the LEDs status of the agent module . Each led will be represented by 4
bits where the first 2 bits (left) will specify the status :
(00=NA, 01=OFF, 10=ON, 11=BLINK)
and the next two bits (right) will specify the color :
(00=GREEN, 01=RED, 10=YELLOW, 11=GRAY)
variables.name: RAD-MIB::agnLed

description: This object specifies the severity of the alarms.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity

description: This trap indicates Loss Of Signal.

Summary.eval: ($v2==3) ? 'Loss of signal detected' : 'Loss of signal resolved'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OPTIMUX-MIB::alarmLOS RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity i 3 RAD-MIB::alarmState i 2 IF-MIB::ifAlias s EXAMPLE

description: This object specifies the severity of the alarms.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity

description: This object is an 'alias' name for the interface as
specified by a network manager, and provides a non-volatile
'handle' for the interface.
On the first instantiation of an interface, the value of
ifAlias associated with that interface is the zero-length
string. As and when a value is written into an instance of
ifAlias through a network management set operation, then the
agent must retain the supplied value in the ifAlias instance
associated with the same interface for as long as that
interface remains instantiated, including across all re-
initializations/reboots of the network management system
including those which result in a change of the interface's
ifIndex value.
An example of the value which a network manager might store
in this object for a WAN interface is the (Telco's) circuit
number/identifier of the interface.
Some agents may support write-access only for interfaces
having particular values of ifType. An agent which supports
write access to this object is required to keep the value in
non-volatile storage, but it may limit the length of new
values depending on how much storage is already occupied by
the current values for other interfaces.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifAlias

description: This trap indicates Loss Of Frame.

Summary.eval: ($v2==3) ? 'Loss of frame detected' : 'Loss of frame resolved'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OPTIMUX-MIB::alarmLOF RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity i 3 RAD-MIB::alarmState i 2 IF-MIB::ifAlias s EXAMPLE

description: This object specifies the severity of the alarms.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity

Some agents may support write-access only for interfaces

variables.name: IF-MIB::ifAlias

description: This trap is sent upon any change in one or more channels.
The actual link status.
remoteFail - No Rx.
localFail - No Tx.
unavailable - No echo replay or replay with invalid code or when connection is in Test state.
valiodationFail - Connection is in not valid state.
standby - offline (can be in pre-sync mode).
tdmFail - oper status is down cause of failure in the tdm.
hwMismatch - the bundle exists on a card that is not installed or has a different
type than the programmed card.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::ip2IfOperStatus

description: This trap indicates AIS.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OPTIMUX-MIB::alarmAIS RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity i 3 RAD-MIB::alarmState i 2 IF-MIB::ifAlias s EXAMPLE

description: This object specifies the severity of the alarms.
